seg.output: I commend your zeal for the settlement of cities, dearest Huldrice, but as wise men consider it daily, they come to the conclusion that they do not know how it can be done. The people of Basel have worked with some, but I do not know what they have attempted. Our people have attempted to convene the delegates of the cities, to settle the expenses of war and consult how they should behave in future. Here is an opportunity, but I do not know if it has been offered to you as well, you will judge. Two of our people have been sent to Wila in favour of the Gauls, one of them, when he comes to you, named Crispinus Vischer, a very wise and faithful man. We shall meditate on the day for the safety of the Christian republic and those things that make for peace. But this one thing I see: "Unless the Lord keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain" [Ps 127:1]. Then the Lord will keep it, when we earnestly sigh to him in prayer, which I fear has been neglected by many and more thought of the arm of flesh.

Bene se habet Megander, et utinam semper sic se habeat.Acta synodi absoluta sunt, sed prae nive nondum ad nos vecta sunt.Hęc sunt, quae ad te scripsi, quae mihi ex animo occurrebant.Bene se habet Megander, et utinam semper sic se habeat.Acta synodi absoluta sunt, sed prae nive nondum ad nos vecta sunt.Hęc sunt, quae ad te scripsi, quae mihi ex animo occurrebant.Valeas, et nos ama.
I praise your zeal in the composition of states, dearest Huldric[!], but the way in which it can be done, when wise men think about it everyday, they come to the conclusion that they do not know. They worked in Basel with some, but I do not know what they tried. Our people tried to get the delegates of the states together to pay for the war expenses and to consult on how they should behave in the future. Here is an opportunity, but I do not know if it is offered to you as well, you will judge. Two of ours were sent to Wil to the favour of the Gallensians, one of them, when he comes to you, Crispinus Vischer, most prudent and faithful. We will meditate day by day for the safety of the Christian Republic and for what contributes to peace. But this I see: "Unless the Lord watches over the city, the watchman will watch in vain" [Ps 127,1] everyone. Then he will guard, when with devotedness we sigh to him in prayers, what I fear has been neglected by many and more thought of the arm of the flesh. May the Lord favor our ministry with his spirit, so that we do not run in vain. Write while you have safe messengers. The prefect in Lenzburg, Otherus Aroę, will pay, while you do not have someone who can go straight to us.
Nevertheless, I do not stop urging the study plan and the hardening. You make me absurd with the Hebrews and the office of the prophet, but you do not deliver anything. I asked you for what you had gathered in the Romans and you never responded. I beg you to forgive the individual weakness and ignorance. For your spirit suits me so much that I can not easily explain it. You do wrong, when you do not provide what I daily refresh.
Megander is doing well and may he always do so. The acts of the synod have been completed, but they have not yet been brought to us due to the snow. These are what I wrote to you, which occurred to me from the heart. Farewell and love us.

Megander is doing well, and I wish he would always be so. The synod proceedings have been completed but have not yet been brought to us due to the snow. I hope that all the delegates remain of sound integrity. Farewell. May Leo and Pelicanus be safe, I have received their letters and small gifts from Funck and will soon respond. You too should be safe with your family. Farewell. Our Zuinglius, William, is doing very well. Farewell. We will care for the boy as if he were our own. You should greet his mother in my name as well. February 20th. Your smallest coin.
